conclusion: Calculate the change in magnetic flux through the coil as it rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.

Magnetic flux Φ through a coil is given by Φ = B ⋅ A ⋅ cos(θ), where B is the magnetic field strength, A is the area of the coil, and θ is the angle between the normal to the plane of the coil and the direction of the magnetic field.
The coil is initially in the x-y plane and the magnetic field is in the x-direction.
The initial magnetic flux is Φ_initial = B ⋅ A ⋅ cos(0°) = 0.1 T ⋅ 0.4 m² ⋅ 1 = 0.04 Wb.
The final magnetic flux is Φ_final = B ⋅ A ⋅ cos(60°) = 0.1 T ⋅ 0.4 m² ⋅ 1/2 = 0.02 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux is ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial = 0.02 Wb - 0.04 Wb = -0.02 Wb.
The negative sign indicates that the magnetic flux has decreased.
The change in the magnetic flux passing through the coil is -0.02 Wb.
